A Franklin College Liberal Arts Education
Master of Science in Athletic Training (MSAT)
Master of Science in Physician Assistant Studies (MSPAS)
We are excited that you want to apply to Franklin. We accept applications throughout the entire year. You can apply

All applicants are assessed holistically in terms of the full range of their academic and personal achievements, and are viewed in the context of the opportunities and challenges they have encountered.
All applications serve as the application for both admission and financial aid.
Students can expect a decision 4-6 weeks after a completed application is received.
All domestic applications are free. International and Running Start applications have a $40 fee.
Master of science in athletic training applicants
submitted by the guidance office or via
Need to register for the test?
Click here to register for the SAT
Click here to register for the ACT
It is your responsibility to provide Franklin with these supporting documents. If you need help with anything,
Other optional items we take into consideration for admission and merit-based financial aid include:
high school transcript, the student’s course load and class rank. College-prep curriculum is preferred. Indiana students with an academic honors diploma will be given priority.
Extracurricular involvement and leadership experience: athletic, literary, artistic, social service, church and community involvement and employment
Demonstrated interest in the school through visits or other interaction with Franklin College staff
Please mail all completed materials to:
submit completed admissions application for maximum aid consideration
Admitted students who submit a completed application, including all supporting documents, on or before December 1 will receive an admitted student packet by mail.
Applicants applying after December 1 are considered on a rolling basis until the class is full and will receive a financial aid packet within 2-3 weeks of filing a complete FAFSA.

Offers of admission and financial aid are valid until May 1. If an enrollment deposit is not received by May 1, Franklin College cannot guarantee you will receive that level of aid or a space in the class.
Once an application is completed, including all supporting documents, you can expect an admissions decision within 4-6 weeks.

Students will automatically be considered for merit-based scholarships after completing an application. Students who would like to be considered for need-based assistance through institutional, state and federal aid programs should file the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) by
. The Franklin College code for FAFSA is
We’re happy you’re interested in Franklin College!
If you have specific questions, contact the Office of Financial Aid at 317.738.8075 or email us at

Learn About Student Success and Retention
Learn about our Master of Science in Physician Assistant Studies
Professors who are on your side and in your corner?
A Franklin College education fosters independent thinking, innovation, leadership and action for ever-changing professions and a globally connected world.
Rub Ben Franklin's nose for good luck or grab a selfie with him on your way to class. You can find his statues around campus.

Franklin College is nationally recognized as a premier college for engaged learning in the liberal arts and sciences, inspiring students to think independently, to question critically and to live, lead and serve meaningfully.
“I think I learned more about teaching in those three days than in any other class about teaching that I’ve taken ever.”

"It’s important to read and important to know what you’re talking about, but actually getting the hands-on experience through internships or interactive classes is what is going to benefit you in a career field.”

“I’ve represented the PSJ at several dinners and met professionals in my field. There’s a level of trust that shows they care when they allow a first year student to be the face of the school that early in her academic career.”
“I feel like Franklin has helped me get out there, talk to people, and get to know them a bit more.”
The Franklin College Board of Trustees has appointed Kerry Prather as acting president of the college, effective immediately. Prather, who…

Franklin College will host the second lecture in its 2019-20 Convocation Lecture Series on Monday, Jan. 20, 2020, as part…

The Franklin College Board of Trustees has welcomed three newly elected members into its ranks. Jon Almeras, E. Lynn Grayson…
I ultimately chose Franklin because classes would be smaller and more engaging. I also knew that I would be more accountable in this environment. - Adam Bunnell '12
